title: Snow White
sentence: The red on the white looked so beautiful that she thought to herself   If only I had a child as white as snow  as red as blood  and as black as the wood in this frame   ~newline~ Soon afterward she had a little daughter who was as white as snow  as red as blood  and as black as ebony wood  and therefore they called her Little Snow White  ~newline~ There was a little table with a white tablecloth and seven little plates  and each plate had a spoon  and there were seven knives and forks and seven mugs as well  ~newline~ Against the wall there were seven little beds  all standing in a row and covered with snow white sheets  ~newline~ From the outside it was beautiful  white with red cheeks  and anyone who saw it would want it  ~newline~ You eat the red half  and I shall eat the white half   ~newline~ The animals too came and mourned for Snow white  first an owl  then a raven  and finally a dove  ~newline~ Snow White lay there in the coffin a long  long time  and she did not decay  but looked like she was asleep  for she was still as white as snow and as red as blood  and as black haired as ebony wood

title: Snow White
sentence: Little Snow White Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm Once upon a time in midwinter  when the snowflakes were falling like feathers from heaven  a queen sat sewing at her window  which had a frame of black ebony wood  ~newline~ As she sewed she looked up at the snow and pricked her finger with her needle  ~newline~ Three drops of blood fell into the snow  ~newline~ The red on the white looked so beautiful that she thought to herself   If only I had a child as white as snow  as red as blood  and as black as the wood in this frame   ~newline~ Soon afterward she had a little daughter who was as white as snow  as red as blood  and as black as ebony wood  and therefore they called her Little Snow White  ~newline~ Against the wall there were seven little beds  all standing in a row and covered with snow white sheets  ~newline~ The queen looked at her with a gruesome stare  laughed loudly  and said   White as snow  red as blood  black as ebony wood  ~newline~ Snow White lay there in the coffin a long  long time  and she did not decay  but looked like she was asleep  for she was still as white as snow and as red as blood  and as black haired as ebony wood

title: Snow White
sentence: She had a magic mirror  ~newline~ Every morning she stood before it  looked at herself  and said   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ To this the mirror answered   You  my queen  are fairest of all  ~newline~ Then she was satisfied  for she knew that the mirror spoke the truth  ~newline~ One day when the queen asked her mirror   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ She stepped before her mirror and said   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ This startled the queen  for she knew that the mirror did not lie  and she realized that the huntsman had deceived her  and that Snow White was still alive  ~newline~ When the wicked woman returned home she went to her mirror and asked   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ The mirror answered once again   You  my queen  are fair  it is true  ~newline~ Back at home the queen stepped before her mirror and said   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ The mirror answered   You  my queen  are fair  it is true  ~newline~ When the queen heard the mirror saying this  she shook and trembled with anger   Snow White shall die   she shouted   if it costs me my life   ~newline~ Back at home she asked her mirror   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ After putting on her beautiful clothes she stepped before her mirror and said   Mirror  mirror  on the wall   Who in this land is fairest of all  ~newline~ The mirror answered  You  my queen  are fair  it is true

title: Snow White
sentence: She was a beautiful woman  but she was proud and arrogant  and she could not stand it if anyone might surpass her in beauty  ~newline~ Then she summoned a huntsman and said to him   Take Snow White out into the woods  ~newline~ He thought   The wild animals will soon devour you anyway   but still it was as if a stone had fallen from his heart  for he would not have to kill her  ~newline~ The poor child was now all alone in the great forest  and she was so afraid that she just looked at all the leaves on the trees and did not know what to do  ~newline~ She ran over sharp stones and through thorns  and wild animals jumped at her  but they did her no harm  ~newline~ Inside the house everything was small  but so neat and clean that no one could say otherwise  ~newline~ Afterward  because she was so tired  she lay down on a bed  but none of them felt right    one was too long  the other too short    until finally the seventh one was just right  ~newline~ They lit their seven candles  and as soon as it was light in their house they saw that someone had been there  for not everything was in the same order as they had left it  ~newline~ The first one said   Who has been sitting in my chair   ~newline~ The second one   Who has been eating from my plate   ~newline~ The third one   Who has been eating my bread   ~newline~ The fourth one   Who has been eating my vegetables   ~newline~ The fifth one   Who has been sticking with my fork   ~newline~ The sixth one   Who has been cutting with my knife   ~newline~ The seventh one   Who has been drinking from my mug   ~newline~ Then the first one saw a that there was a little imprint in his bed  and said   Who stepped on my bed   ~newline~ The others came running up and shouted   Someone has been lying in mine as well   ~newline~ But the seventh one  looking at his bed  found Snow White lying there asleep  ~newline~ They fetched their seven candles and shone the light on Snow White  ~newline~ The seventh dwarf had to sleep with his companions  one hour with each one  and then the night was done  ~newline~ During the day the girl was alone  ~newline~ Do not let anyone in   ~newline~ Coloring her face  she disguised herself as an old peddler woman  so that no one would recognize her  ~newline~ And she took out one that was braided from colorful silk  ~newline~  Would you like this one   ~newline~  I can let that honest woman in   thought Snow White  then unbolted the door and bought the pretty bodice lace  ~newline~  You used to be the most beautiful one   said the old woman  and hurried away  ~newline~ When the dwarfs heard what had happened they said   The old peddler woman was no one else but the godless queen  ~newline~ Take care and let no one in when we are not with you   ~newline~ Then with the art of witchcraft  which she understood  she made a poisoned comb  ~newline~ I am not allowed to let anyone in   ~newline~  You surely may take a look   said the old woman  pulling out the poisoned comb and holding it up  ~newline~ They examined her and found the poisoned comb  ~newline~ Once again they warned her to be on guard and not to open the door for anyone  ~newline~ Then she went into her most secret room    no one else was allowed inside    and she made a poisoned  poisoned apple  ~newline~ From the outside it was beautiful  white with red cheeks  and anyone who saw it would want it  ~newline~ But anyone who might eat a little piece of it would died  ~newline~ Snow White stuck her head out the window and said   I am not allowed to let anyone in  ~newline~ Here  I ll give you one of them   ~newline~ Now the apple had been so artfully made that only the red half was poisoned  ~newline~ Snow White longed for the beautiful apple  and when she saw that the peasant woman was eating part of it she could no longer resist  and she stuck her hand out and took the poisoned half  ~newline~ Then they put the coffin outside on a mountain  and one of them always stayed with it and watched over her  ~newline~ I will honor her and respect her as my most cherished one   ~newline~ But then it happened that one of them stumbled on some brush  and this dislodged from Snow White s throat the piece of poisoned apple that she had bitten off  ~newline~ Beginning with the edition of       the poisoned apple is dislodged when a servant accidentally stumbles while carrying the coffin to the prince s castle

dwarfs answered   We will not sell it for all the gold in the world   ~newline~ As he thus spoke  the good dwarfs felt pity for him and gave him the coffin

sentence: Little Snow White Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm Once upon a time in midwinter  when the snowflakes were falling like feathers from heaven  a queen sat sewing at her window  which had a frame of black ebony wood  ~newline~ The red on the white looked so beautiful that she thought to herself   If only I had a child as white as snow  as red as blood  and as black as the wood in this frame   ~newline~ Soon afterward she had a little daughter who was as white as snow  as red as blood  and as black as ebony wood  and therefore they called her Little Snow White  ~newline~ The queen looked at her with a gruesome stare  laughed loudly  and said   White as snow  red as blood  black as ebony wood  ~newline~ They said   We cannot bury her in the black earth   and they had a transparent glass coffin made  so she could be seen from all sides  ~newline~ Snow White lay there in the coffin a long  long time  and she did not decay  but looked like she was asleep  for she was still as white as snow and as red as blood  and as black haired as ebony wood
